definition: owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: The irony of humanism is that it dehumanizes .
sentences.chinese: 諷刺的是，它的人文主義人性。

sentences.english: It is of great significance to strengthen humanist education in order to change the bad social mood.
sentences.chinese: 加強人文主義教育對改變社會不良風氣具有重要意義。

sentences.english: The Renaissance and Humanism: Humanism is the key-note of the Renaissance.
sentences.chinese: 文藝復興，提倡理性，人文主義。

sentences.english: In the early 20th century, Irving Babbitt advocated New-Humanism.
sentences.chinese: 20世紀初，美國思想家白璧德提出了新人文主義。

sentences.english: The Beginnings of Humanism in Fourteenth-Century Italy.
sentences.chinese: 十四世紀意大利人文主義思潮的開端。

sentences.english: Lit-sen Chang, A Christian Criticism of Humanism.
This is the humanist philosophy known as tach'ing, or " fulfillment of instincts".
sentences.chinese: 這就是所謂“達情”的人文主義哲學。

sentences.english: It was exquisite in style and form, full of humanism and love.
sentences.chinese: 精緻的樣式和風格，充滿了人文主義和關懷。

sentences.english: And the human spirit in Lu Yous poetry of landscape has attracted even less attention.
sentences.chinese: 其山水詩中的人文主義精神，更不爲人們重視。

sentences.english: Confucius and Confucian School inherited and developed the traditional humanist thought.
sentences.chinese: 孔子繼承並發展了傳統的人文主義思想。

sentences.english: The children-oriented idea came from western humanism.
sentences.chinese: 兒童本位觀念源於西方人文主義思潮。

sentences.english: Secular Humanism has emerged as the dominant faith of the elite.
sentences.chinese: 世俗人文主義成爲菁英界的主要信仰。

sentences.english: Does it not run the risk of slipping into a variety of ethical humanism?
sentences.chinese: 它難道不會有向各種種族人文主義傾斜的危險嗎？

sentences.english: But they're all much more comfortable having rational discussions at the Humanist center.
sentences.chinese: 但是在人文主義中心的理性討論要使他們自在得多。

sentences.english: On the other hand, it is full of humanism and human thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 其次是充滿人道精神的人文主義和人文關懷。

sentences.english: He received an honorary doctorate degree in Humane Letters.
sentences.chinese: 他剛獲得了人文主義文學名譽博士學位。

definition: Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel (1770-1831), German philosopher
to take an alternate route (idiom)/to find an alternative/to take a different approach/to blaze a new trail
